newsitem.title: ITALY: San Paolo cuts prime lending rate.
newsitem.headline: San Paolo cuts prime lending rate.

text.p: Italy's largest commercial banking group San Paolo said it was lowering its prime lending rate 25 basis points to 8.75 percent effective July 4.
San Paolo said deposit rates would also fall in line with the Bank of Italy's reduction in the return on bank reserve requirements announced last Friday.
The lending rate cut follows the central bank's easing of 50 basis points in its official rates last week, setting teh discount rate at 6.25 percent.
Italy's largest savings bank Cariplo has already announced a 50 basis point reduction to 8.5 percent in its prime lending rate.
